newsitem.title: ITALY: Telecom savings reopen sharply lower.
newsitem.headline: Telecom savings reopen sharply lower.

text.p: The savings shares of Italian telecom operator Telecom Italia reopened sharply lower after being earlier suspensed on the Milan bourse, dealers said.

Telecom Italia savings shares reopened down 17.7 percent this afternoon after trading margins had been widened to 20 percent from 10 percent. The savings shares were last quoted down 18.1 percent at 3,115 lire.
Earlier, savings shares in telecoms holding STET had reopened lower also after earlier suspension. The shares were last off 17.9 percent at 5,500 lire.

The two savings shares were suspended after falling sharply early Monday following a statement from the Italian Treasury on Friday which said these savings shares would not be converted into ordinary shares when STET and Telecom Italia are merged.
